intro: Diodia alata var. plicata, commonly known as winged diodia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in sandy or loamy soils and is often found in open, disturbed areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
